metadata.Title: CVE-2013-2120 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The %{password(...)} macro in pastemacroexpander.cpp in the KDE Paste Applet before 4.10.5 in kdeplasma-addons does not properly generate passwords, which allows context-dependent attackers to bypass authentication via a brute-force attack.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2120` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

kdeplasma-addons - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.1
plasma-containments-addons - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.1
plasma-dataengines-addons - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.1
plasma-runners-addons - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.1
plasma-wallpapers-addons - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.1
plasma-widget-kdeobservatory - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.1
plasma-widget-kimpanel - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.1
plasma-widget-lancelot - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.1
plasma-widgets-addons - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: kdeplasma-addons package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:4.13.3-0ubuntu0.1').
